resources.string: Aeternum is for the bold, for those who embrace the call of battle. If you are such a soul, speak with Gwendolin Drake for a chance to craft a truly astounding bulwark of heavy armor.
True, true. But I've heard of something that could help against the troubles.\n\nLegendary armor that makes the wearer into a veritable fortress!
Battle's Embrace. It was once worn by a powerful commander, who marched against the Corrupted and beat them back to Shattered Mountain.\n\nBut then the commander, and the armor, vanish from the tale.

No, the legends are hazy on what happened after the commander reached Shattered Mountain.\n\nAll that is left are the patterns used to make the armor. With these, and some materials, the armor could be reforged.
Keep alert for any of the materials needed to craft Battle's Embrace.\n\nWearing that armor is sure to inspire an entire generation of new warriors to fight against the Corrupted.
Do my eyes deceive me? You found all the materials to craft Battle's Embrace?\n\nYes, yes! To think, I get to see this legendary armor in action!
"Does it look as the legends say?"
Yes! It's everything I hoped! May it hold you in its embrace, protecting you from the battles that surely lie ahead.\n\nI'll have quite the tale to share tonight - Battle's Embrace has returned!
Complete Quest: Ahead of the Rest
Collect Stout Fenton Hides from Fenton Hamlet, Treated Hobnails from Cayo de la Muerte, and Restless Metal Bands from Festering Flotsam. Then visit a Tier 3 Forge to craft the Battle's Embrace Boots.
Travel to the {POITags} in Cutlass Keys to collect Treated Hobnails
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Restless Metal Bands
Collect Stalwart Rivets from The Golden Princess, Evershine Polish from Gelida Pillars, and Hammered Metal from Acedia Bastion. Then visit a Tier 3 Forge to craft the Battle's Embrace Breastplate.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Stalwart Rivets
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Evershine Polish
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Hammered Metal
Collect Baneseed Oil from Fort Damnation, Attuned Starmetal from Propus, and Reforged Plating from Olympus. Then visit a Tier 3 Forge to craft the Battle's Embrace Greaves.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Baneseed Oil
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Attuned Starmetal
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Reforged Plating
Collect Refined Balefire from Svikin's Stand, Flexible Mesh from Vela, and Essence of Power from Litheltop. Then visit a Tier 3 Forge to craft the Battle's Embrace Gauntlets.
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Refined Balefire
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Flexible Mesh
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Essence of Power
Craft the parts of Battle's Embrace at a Forge
Collect Rugged Varnish from Nettlevex, Shards of Battle from Lower Slag Mine, and Heavy Padding from Upper Slag Mine. Then visit a Tier 3 Forge to craft the Battle's Embrace Helm.
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Rugged Varnish
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Shards of Battle
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Heavy Padding
The former executioner Joseph Black is offering to pass on his knowledge of how to craft a truly gnarly Great Axe.

Sounds like paradise on earth… wait, what were we talking about? Oh yes - the Executioner.\n\nI'll give you a list of the elements required to reforge it. They might be a challenge to find, but I think it's worth it.
Oh! It's… your name is still eluding me, but I remember something about… oh yes, the axe, Executioner.\n\nGood luck finding everything you'll need.
Impressive, very impressive. Swing swift and become an arbiter of death. Wield it well. \n\nNow, if you'll leave me - I think I might stay here a while. The churchyard is… filled with death.
An old priest with expertise in both life and death magic is looking to lend his teachings to those who wish to heal this broken island and become a true beacon of hope.
Oh, you would not find such a thing, not for many centuries now. But I can show you to remake it.\n\nTake this list of the elements required, and then you can make the staff, "Hope Manifest."
You seek the elements of the staff, still?\n\nYou will find them, if you keep trying.
There is the new light of Brightwood, and you found everything you needed, yes?\n\nWith that staff in hand, you are the very thing, "Hope Manifest." Brightness will follow, wherever you go.
Collect items used to craft the Executioner
Collect items used to craft the Executioner
Collect items used to craft the Executioner
Collect items then craft the Executioner
The most treacherous of pirates only know one love: the sea's embrace.
Those bound to their fates in a gallows cannot escape them. Only you can deliver them.
The most brutal of us must give away their mercy, for they have none to show their foes.
Even the hottest blood running through veins oft still into fetid darkness.
Collect items used to craft Hope Manifest
Collect items used to craft Hope Manifest
Collect items used to craft Hope Manifest
Collect items then craft Hope Manifest
Healing lies in the cloth of the mender, who dresses wounds carefully like an aegis.
Healing lies in the salve of the sooth sayer, a calming touch to numb pain.
Healing lies in the Breath of Mercy, a gift from the Fates who continue to weave.
Healing lies in hope, the hope to live, and those who catalyze that hope.
Travel to {POITags} in Cutlass Keys to collect Bucaneer's Plank
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Blade of the Brutes
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect the Infernal Coagulant
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Soothsayer's Salve
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Mercy's Breath
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Hope Catalyst
Complete Quest: Cut from the Same Cloth
Complete Quest: The Ties that Bind
Tillian Parsons is a master of blades. If your wits are sharp and your temper is keen, she'll show you how to craft a legendary sword.

Excellent! I call it "Keen Temper," and I'd be pleased just to see the blade put to the test.\n\nIf you can gather all the elements needed for it, I think it'll make you a warrior without equal. Good luck!
Still questing for the materials to forge "Keen Temper"?\n\nFirst time you swing the sword, it'll all be worth it. I promise.

That's the swagger of a true swashbuckler, I see! You got everything you needed for the blade, didn't you?\n\nAnd now you'll be wielding the sharpest sword this island's ever seen. "Keen Temper," indeed! You take care of that weapon, you hear?
Collect items used to craft Keen Temper
Collect items used to craft Keen Temper
Collect items used to craft Keen Temper
Collect items then craft Keen Temper
A fine leather grip is the steadiest, and most natural in hand.
An edge sharpened on a grindstone is an art in and of itself.
Collect oil to quench the beast, for water would bubble the blade.
A well-made blade is a Captain's best friend, regardless of their morals.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Hilt Leather
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Quenching Oil
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect the Captain's Blade
A shadowy thief knows the secrets of a long lost assassin armor set. She'll teach you, if you prove yourself.
A band of assassins once created an armor set to help them sneak past the horrors of this island. \n\nThis armor is said to give the wearer a soft step and the demeanor of a shadow.

Ah, that's what makes the armor a legend. No one knows the location of the original set. \n\nIt's said each of the assassins took a piece when they disbanded. But the pattern to make the armor remains intact.
Shrouded Intent. Personally, I think the assassins were being humorous when they chose that name. \n\nHere, take this pattern and see if you can find the items needed to make this armor.
Keep your eyes peeled. What you need to craft the Shrouded Intent armor is well hidden. \n\nEspecially since the materials required are scattered across Aeternum.

Is that…? Well I'll be. To see it remade… I never thought I'd be around when it happened. \n\nIt suits you. Though, are you sure you won't part with it? It would make a fine addition to my collection…
Heh, I wasn't serious! It's worth more than I could pay. \n\nI know you'll put Shrouded Intent to better use than I ever could.

Collect Soaked Pullpatch Leather from Pullpatch Cover, Muffled Fen Padding from Karburg, and Essence of Shadow from Cutthroat Cavern. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Shrouded Intent Boots.
Travel to {POITags} in Weaver's Fen to collect Muffled Fen Padding
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Essence of Shadow
Craft the pieces of Shrouded intent at an Outfitting Station

Collect Stormsail Scraps from Ravaged Wreck, Blightbane Pitch from Minnow's Revenge, and Hunter's Shark Clasps from The Plundering Shark. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Shrouded Intent Coat.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Stormsail Scraps
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Hunter's Shark Clasps
Collect Murkmoss Extract from Fornax, Castaway Rigging from the Castaway Shores, and Nightstone Slivers from Haedus. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Shrouded Intent Pants.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Murkmoss Extract
Travel to the {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Castaway Rigging
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Nightstone Slivers
Collect Layered Guardian Leather from Subra, Siphoned Twilight from Litheltop, and Duskfall Dye from High-Pass Mountain. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Shrouded Intent Gloves.
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Layered Guardian Leather

Collect Infused Orichalcum Thread from Lower Slag Mine, Smudged Feathers from the Genesis of Spite, and Umbral Cloth from Bramblecliff. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Shrouded Intent Hat.
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Infused Orichalcum Thread
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Smudged Feathers
Travel to {POITags} in Edengrove to collect Umbral Cloth
Ajax Halfhand is an archer with one ear ever to the wind. He is looking for someone with a sturdy hand and a sharp eye to pass on the secrets of a legendary bow.

Wouldn't you, though? It'll be up to you to do all the leg work.\n\nIf you can collect all the materials on the list, I think this bow - "the Huntress" - will be the envy of everyone in town. Good luck!
Ah, still tracking down the Huntress, are you?\n\nIt'll take some time, I reckon.

Look at you - fresh in from the wilds and now a legendary tracker, at least to my mind. Finding all the materials can't have been easy. \n\nBut the Huntress - she'll take good care of you. Keep your quiver full out there.
An odd Pyromancer is speaking with the flames. If you listen to his fiery teachings, he'll show you how to craft a legendary Fire Staff.

Yes, the voice in the flames. I call her Falmea. Her presence is felt when you place your hand close to the fire. \n\nShe is the spirit of Falmea’s Wrath, a fire staff I conceived. Would you like to craft it?
Still hunting for the elements to make "Falmea's Wrath"? Keep at it. \n\nThis fire staff is not for the faint of heart.
Ah, behold! Falmea's Wrath! A discerning eye can see how the fires converge in this fine wood. \n\nWield it with pride, {playerName}. May your deeds prove worthy of such a fine weapon.
Collect items used to craft the Huntress
Collect items used to craft the Huntress
Collect items used to craft the Huntress
Collect items then craft the Huntress
She hides among the trees. Among the redwoods, she is truly at home.
The resin of the tree perfumes the air. If you're all alone, yet notice that scent, beware.
With eyes like the hawk, she sees for miles. Her vision is clear.
She closes upon her prey, and slowly pulls back. The freedom she feels is like that of an arrow.
Collect items used to craft Falmea's Wrath
Collect items used to craft Falmea's Wrath
Collect items used to craft Falmea's Wrath
Collect items then craft Falmea's Wrath
Falmea burned the Wyrdwood into the air, and left the air hanging with great sorrow.
Falmea let ashes from the Wyrdwood fall. A pure white on the ground, felled.
Falmea revealed her unhallowed water and sprinkled it into the ash.
Falmea spoke the unspeakable and, from a tornado of flame, retrieved a staff.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Ancient Wood
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Wyrdwood Resin
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Hawk Feather
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect a Lucky Rabbit's Foot
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Singed Branches
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Wyrdwood Ashes
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Unhallowed Water
Travel to the top of {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect the Heart of All Flame
Complete Quest: Like Wood in a Forest
Complete Quest: Good Resin, Sound Reasoning
Complete Quest: Feathers of a Hawk
Complete Quest: To Chase a Tardy Rabbit
Complete Quest: Naught but Smoldering Ash
The strange druid Fiona Harrower is offering to share the secrets of a magical medium armor set.

Call it what you will. All beings need wings, whatever their fashion. The shell of a turtle, the legs of a leopard, all are wings that take us to our destiny. \n\nLike Daedalus with his his wax and string, I too have a blueprint for mystical feathers. Something with which you would find both freedom and protection. If you are so inclined.
My pattern can transform you from this mewling little owlet into a wise and fearsome hunter of the night.

Leave the doubting to the wind and its fickle friends. I'll craft you the means. It is up to your to learn to soar.\n\nI call it the Protective Wyrd. Collect these materials, and you may yet find yourself a master of the night.
Nothing is truly lost on Aeternum, or so I tell myself.\n\nWhen the time is right, you will find what you need to craft the Protective Wyrd, I know you will.
There's something about you... Oh! You found everything you needed!\n\nThis is the most impressive attire I've ever laid eyes on. I can feel the power of the Protective Wyrd from here.
Little bird becomes the wind. Talons sharp and eyes piercing. May you soar away from danger and snatch your prey with the swiftest sroke.
Complete Quest: Step in the Right Direction
Collect Hallowed Fabric from Fenton Hamlet, Essence of Undeath from Cutthroat Cavern, and Purified Pitch from Jetsam Isle. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Protected Wyrd Shoes.
Travel to {POITags} in Weaver's Fen to collect Hallowed Fabric
Collect {itemName} from Revenant, Ghoul, and Impaler enemies
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Essence of Undeath
Craft the parts of Protective Wyrd at an Outfitting Station

Collect Neptunian Buckles from Neptune's Fury, Consecrated Thread from Solitude Cemetery, and Ancient Armor Scraps from Gelida Pillars. Then visit a Tier 3 Outfitting Station to craft the Protected Wyrd Shirt.
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Neptunian Buckles
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Consecrated Thread
Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Ancient Armor Scraps

Travel to {POITags} in Great Cleave to collect Stitched Wards
Travel to {POITags} in Restless Shore to collect Ceremonial Worked Wool
Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Infused Lining

Travel to {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Cragview Reinforced Weave
Travel to the {POITags} in Mourningdale to collect Wyrdwood Charms
